hero.heading: Clad-wood
hero.copy: One side of a clad-wood frame grows on trees while the other side is made in a factory. Clad-wood is low-maintenance and versatile.

inspiration.heading: The easy maintenance
copy: The exterior frame material acts like a suit of armor for the wood inside. The protective finish makes it easy to care for. No repainting required.

small.alt: Jeld-Wen W-2500 Aluminum Clad Wood Sliding Patio Door

inspiration.heading: The best of both worlds
copy: Your patio door’s interior frame can be matched to any wood trim or molding inside your home while you enjoy the benefits of a metal or fiberglass exterior.

inspiration.heading: When to choose wood
copy: Since wood frames need more upkeep, most people only choose wood if they live in a historic home. Though, wood innately has grain color and texture that other materials just imitate. Plus, scratches are easy to repair.

small.alt: Jeld-Wen W-4500. Wood Sliding Patio Door

next.heading: Next, let’s talk about fiberglass.
next.copy: Fiberglass frames are durable, low maintenance and can even look like wood.
